answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some documents that may help you with your own RFP.
Below are three sample Request For Proposals.
1-The first is from the City of Oakland, CA’s Department of Parks and Recreation requesting printing services.
http://www.oaklandnet.com/parks/0/doc/012810_rfp_print_services.pdf
2-The second RFP comes from the New Jersey Highlands Water Protection and Planning Council for overall printing services.
http://www.state.nj.us/njhighlands/master/rmp/rfp_offset_printing_services.pdf
3- The third example is an RFP for the citywide printing services in Huntington Beach, CA. 
http://www.ci.huntington-beach.ca.us/business/bids_rfps/bids/Citywide-Print-and-Copy-Services--09222010.pdf
I also found a document about general RFP writing which may help you while creating your own document.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302081/Best_Practices_for_RFPs
Finally, for some additional information a similar question to yours was previously asked on the Knowledge Network. You can see that question and its answer below.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/20776
I hope these offer some help!
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

I found some documents that may help you with your own RFP.

1-The first is from the City of Oakland, CA’s Department of Parks and Recreation requesting printing services.

answers.author: Colin Walker
answers.text:
The City of Bellevue, WA, is actually in the process of re-contracting for these services right now.  Our printing contracts are currently structured as follows:

Web press printing for our city's quarterly newspaper, the parks program brochure, and a variety of other web press jobs is covered by one contract with a local printer.  The printer was chosen through a competitive process.
Offset print services are covered by several separate contracts (4 if I'm remembering correctly) with a combination of offset printers and print brokers.  These printers were chosen through a competitive process, and essentially became a roster of providers from which staff can choose.
Our in-house copy center, multi-functional devices, mail/courier services, and city hall central receiving and distribution were recruited through a third RFP.  (Coincidentally, we just finished the first round of vendor interviews this morning)  Presently, one vendor provides MFDs and copy center services, and another vendor provides mail/courier and central receiving/distribution.  We're not sure yet which direction we are going to go with the next contract, aside from keeping the copy center in-house.

As part of the current RFP, we requested information on alternative approaches to the copy center function.  I had expected to see more proposals come in touting the benefits of moving the operation off-site, but the off-site options were really limited.  This may have been because we still required vendors to provide an on-site presence due to customer expectations.
Prior to moving into the RFP process, we started with an RFI.  There were some innovative concepts that came out of the RFI responses, particularly in the approach to MFDs.  Much has changed since the last time we went out to RFP, so it was a great opportunity to learn about what was new in the market (i.e. "cloud" printing - in quotes because the "cloud" is really just a print server in most cases).  For the most part, though, the RFI was a bit disappointing and turned into a product dog & pony show, which was what we were trying to avoid.
If you email me, I'd be happy to send you the RFI and RFP we used for our process.
Colin Walker
Community Relations Coordinator
Bellevue Parks & Community Services
cwalker@bellevuewa.gov | 425-452-7248
A CAPRA Accredited Agency

author: [Anonymous]
text: Our local government currently operates an in-house print shop.  We would like to see examples of Requests for Information (RFI) or Requests for Proposals (RFP) that requests/provides analysis services to assist in determining best practices in providing print for a government organization.  Can anyone provide a copy of their document or award?
title: Printing Services
